event.title: Saturday and two deaths were reported

data.event: â ” Tens of thousands of Kansas utility customers were without power Saturday and two deaths were reported as an early spring blizzard buried parts of Kansas in snow and ice.
â ” Tens of thousands of Kansas utility customers were without power Saturday and two deaths were reported as an early spring blizzard buried parts of Kansas in snow and ice.
A 72-year-old man Hutchinson man was shoveling snow and died of an apparent heart attack Saturday, according to the adjutant general's office.
On Friday, a 58-year-old woman was killed in a car accident on icy roadways in Marion County.

event.title: dropped several inches of snow around Riley County Friday night

data.event: The storm, which dropped several inches of snow around Riley County Friday night and Saturday, did little damage locally, officials said.

event.title: Saturday, did little damage locally, officials said

data.event: The storm, which dropped several inches of snow around Riley County Friday night and Saturday, did little damage locally, officials said.
The Highway Patrol also sent out a plane Saturday to fly over areas of southwest and south-central Kansas to look for stranded drivers.

event.title: opened armories in Dodge City, Great Bend, Hutchinson, Kingman, Larned, Pratt and West Wichita Saturday

data.event: The National Guard also opened armories in Dodge City, Great Bend, Hutchinson, Kingman, Larned, Pratt and West Wichita Saturday as warming stations.
Earlier Saturday, Sebelius signed a declaration of disaster emergency for 62 counties, allowing state resources to help local officials.
